refsect1.title: Object Hierarchy
refsect1.screen: GBoxed ╰── GstMpegtsSection GEnum ├── GstMpegtsSectionTableID ├── GstMpegtsSectionType ╰── GstMpegtsStreamType

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: For more details, refer to the ITU H.222.0 or ISO/IEC 13818-1 specifications and other specifications mentioned in the documentation.

refsect2.title: gst_message_new_mpegts_section ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstMessage for a GstMpegtsSection .

entry.para: The GstMpegtsSection to put in a message.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The new GstMessage to be posted, or NULL if the section is not valid.

refsect2.title: gst_message_parse_mpegts_section ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GstMpegtsSection contained in a message.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_send_event ()
refsect2.para: Creates a custom GstEvent with a GstMpegtsSection . The GstEvent is sent to the element GstElement.

entry.para: The GstElement to send to section event to.
The GstMpegtsSection to put in the event.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the event is sent

refsect2.title: gst_event_parse_mpegts_section ()
refsect2.para: Extracts the GstMpegtsSection contained in the event GstEvent

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_packetize ()
refsect2.para: If the data in section has already been packetized, the data pointer is returned immediately. Otherwise, the data field is allocated and populated.

entry.para: the GstMpegtsSection that holds the data.
gsize to hold the size of the data.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: pointer to section data, or NULL on fail.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstMpegtsSection * gst_mpegts_section_new (guint16 pid, guint8 *data, gsize data_size);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstMpegtsSection from the provided data .
Note: Ensuring data is big enough to contain the full section is the responsibility of the caller. If it is not big enough, NULL will be returned.
Note: it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure data does point to the beginning of the section.

entry.para: the PID to which this section belongs
a pointer to the beginning of the section (i.e. the first byte should contain the table_id field).

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A new GstMpegtsSection if the data was valid, else NULL.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_get_pat ()
refsect2.para: Parses a Program Association Table (ITU H.222.0, ISO/IEC 13818-1).
Returns the array of GstMpegtsPatProgram contained in the section.
Note: The PAT "transport_id" field corresponds to the "subtable_extension" field of the provided section .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The GstMpegtsPatProgram contained in the section, or NULL if an error happened. Release with g_ptr_array_unref when done.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_pat_new ()
refsect2.para: Allocates a new GPtrArray for GstMpegtsPatProgram

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_pat_program_new ()
refsect2.para: Allocates a new GstMpegtsPatProgram.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_from_pat ()
refsect2.para: Creates a PAT GstMpegtsSection from the programs array of GstMpegtsPatPrograms

entry.para: Transport stream ID of the PAT

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_get_pmt ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GstMpegtsPMT contained in the section .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The GstMpegtsPMT contained in the section, or NULL if an error happened.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_pmt_new ()
refsect2.para: Allocates and initializes a new GstMpegtsPMT.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_pmt_stream_new ()
refsect2.para: Allocates and initializes a new GstMpegtsPMTStream.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_from_pmt ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GstMpegtsSection from pmt that is bound to pid

entry.para: a GstMpegtsPMT to create a GstMpegtsSection from.
The PID that the GstMpegtsPMT belongs to

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_get_tsdt ()
refsect2.para: Returns the array of GstMpegtsDescriptor contained in the section

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The GstMpegtsDescriptor contained in the section, or NULL if an error happened. Release with g_array_unref when done.

refsect2.title: gst_mpegts_section_get_cat ()
refsect2.para: Returns the array of GstMpegtsDescriptor contained in the Conditional Access Table.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The GstMpegtsDescriptor contained in the section, or NULL if an error happened. Release with g_array_unref when done.

refsect2.title: struct GstMpegtsSection
refsect2.para: Mpeg-TS Section Information (SI) (ISO/IEC 13818-1)

entry.para: The pid on which this section was found
The table id of this section
This meaning differs per section. See the documentation of the parsed section type for the meaning of this field
Applies to current/next stream or not
Number of the last expected section (if multiple)

refsect2.title: enum GstMpegtsSectionTableID
refsect2.para: Values for a GstMpegtsSection table_id
These are the registered ITU H.222.0 | ISO/IEC 13818-1 table_id variants.
see also GstMpegtsSectionATSCTableID, GstMpegtsSectionDVBTableID, and GstMpegtsSectionSCTETableID

refsect2.title: enum GstMpegtsSectionType
refsect2.para: Types of GstMpegtsSection that the library handles.

refsect2.title: struct GstMpegtsPatProgram
refsect2.para: A program entry from a Program Association Table (ITU H.222.0, ISO/IEC 13818-1).

entry.para: the network of program map PID

refsect2.title: struct GstMpegtsPMT
refsect2.para: Program Map Table (ISO/IEC 13818-1).
The program_number is contained in the subtable_extension field of the container GstMpegtsSection.

entry.para: PID of the stream containing PCR

refsect2.title: struct GstMpegtsPMTStream
refsect2.para: An individual stream definition.

entry.para: the type of stream. See GstMpegtsStreamType

refsect2.title: enum GstMpegtsStreamType
refsect2.para: Type of mpeg-ts stream type.

These values correspond to the base standard registered types. Depending on the variant of mpeg-ts being used (Bluray, ATSC, DVB, ...), other types might also be used, but will not conflict with these.
Corresponds to table 2-34 of ITU H.222.0 | ISO/IEC 13818-1

entry.para: Rec. ITU-T H.262 | ISO/IEC 13818-2 Video or ISO/IEC 11172-2 constrained parameter video stream
ISO/IEC 13818-7 Audio with ADTS transport syntax
ISO/IEC 14496-3 Audio with the LATM transport syntax as defined in ISO/IEC 14496-3
ISO/IEC 14496-1 SL-packetized stream or FlexMux stream carried in PES packets
ISO/IEC 14496-1 SL-packetized stream or FlexMux stream carried in ISO/IEC 14496_sections
Metadata carried in ISO/IEC 13818-6 Data Carousel
Metadata carried in ISO/IEC 13818-6 Object Carousel
Metadata carried in ISO/IEC 13818-6 Synchronized Download Protocol
IPMP stream (defined in ISO/IEC 13818-11, MPEG-2 IPMP)

AVC video stream conforming to one or more profiles defined in Annex A of Rec. ITU-T H.264 | ISO/IEC 14496-10 or AVC video sub-bitstream of SVC as defined in 2.1.78 or MVC base view sub-bitstream, as defined in 2.1.85, or AVC video sub-bitstream of MVC, as defined in 2.1.88
ISO/IEC 14496-3 Audio, without using any additional transport syntax, such as DST, ALS and SLS
Auxiliary video stream as defined in ISO/IEC 23002-3
SVC video sub-bitstream of an AVC video stream conforming to one or more profiles defined in Annex G of Rec. ITU-T H.264 | ISO/IEC 14496-10
MVC video sub-bitstream of an AVC video stream conforming to one or more profiles defined in Annex H of Rec. ITU-T H.264 | ISO/IEC 14496-10
Video stream conforming to one or more profiles as defined in Rec. ITU-T T.800 | ISO/IEC 15444-1
Additional view Rec. ITU-T H.262 | ISO/IEC 13818-2 video stream for service-compatible stereoscopic 3D services
Additional view Rec. ITU-T H.264 | ISO/IEC 14496-10 video stream conforming to one or more profiles defined in Annex A for service-compatible stereoscopic 3D services
